newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Arafat awaits Clinton's call, Mubarak's response.
newsitem.headline: Arafat awaits Clinton's call, Mubarak's response.

text.p: U.S. President Bill Clinton will call Palestinian President Yasser Arafat at 7 p.m. (1700 GMT) on Sunday to formally invite him to a Washington summit with Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, PLO officials said.
They said Arafat was still trying to convince Egypt's President Hosni Mubarak, who wanted his own Middle East summit in Cairo, to attend Washington's meeting on Tuesday.
Arafat's spokesman Marwan Kanafani told Reuters: "We are waiting for President Clinton to call President Arafat at 7 o'clock and then everything will be decided."
Kanafani told the U.S. Cable News Network: "It doesn't look good though. It seems Mubarak is not participating in Washington's summit."
"The President (Arafat) is trying to convince President Mubarak to join him in Washington," Kanafani said.
PLO Executive Committee member Mahmoud Abbas said Arafat and senior PLO leaders were still studying an invitation to Washington's summit.
